title: PHPdefaultKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPdefaultKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Use default to handle unspecified cases in a switch block:
<?php
$a = 4;
switch($a) {
case 1: echo "One"; break;
case 2: 
  echo "Two"; break;
case 3: echo "Three"; break;
default: 
  echo "Many"; break;
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
default
keyword is used in a
switch
block to specify which code to run when none
of the
case
statements were matched by the expression.
Related Pages
The
switch
keyword.
Read more about the switch conditional in our
PHP switch Statement Tutorial
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPdefaultKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPdefaultKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
